author: A_Brickset_user
title: VERY KOOL
review: This book's mad kool. It tells you a brief history of lego, and about the legoland parks. What's really kool is that it shows you some of the works of the masterbuilders, including a huge Grand Central Station. Buy it if ya see it, but its kinda rare, now.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Buy it, you won't regret it!
review:
This is a very nice book that should be in every Legocollection!
It has two pages with american cars in Legoland size including the red '57 Chevy on the cover, which I have constructed from this picture, very beautiful.
Once again: a must have for every collector.

author: mrmitch
title: Awesome birthday gift
review: Seven years I got this book for my birthday. It is very interesting and well thought out. It gives a history of LEGO and shows some very detailed models built by the pro's. Great gift idea for any serious LEGO fan. I enjoy flipping threw it still!

author: Porsche911
title: A good read
review: This book tells the history of Lego with a well thought out timeline and has some cool pictures of giant Lego creations and Legoland. It also has some cool facts about Lego like how many different ways there are to connect two 2X4 bricks. This is a great book for any Lego fan. Pick one up if you can.

author: Da_LegoBuilder
title: the ultimate book of all time...
review:
I saw this book, and i could have sworn i had it. After going into my room and looking at my bookshelf, it finally found it!

It brings back good memories, i remember rading this book once i got it. This book tells how they make the stuff on display at lego land, special stuff made out of lego, and even Mt. Rushmore out of LEgo! I am amazed how they made all of these sets, by computer! They even made the sydney opera house, submarine,a town,a globe,books, animals and the statue of liberty!
If you see this book, it is worth your money to buy it!

author: smiley905
title: great book
review: this book has everything you could want, it has pictures of old toys, sets and models biult by the lego creatures. it has lots of nice pictures and things to read. i think it definetly deserves a five it has no flaws.

author: Imperial13
title: Great!
review: One of the coolest "sets" out there (not anymore), as it includes many a pages of master works, information about the history of LEGO, and much more. This has to be a required read among all LEGo fans like The Unofficial LEGO Builders Guide!

author: water_jedi_17
title: Ultimate lego book
review:
This book has everything you need to know about lego with 128 pages filled with lots of facts.
Part one, the lego story has a foreward by K.K.Kristiansen plus a lego timeline from 1949 to 1999 including themes that appeared during those times. In the final part it shows you how  lego sets are produced from the concept art to the boxeswith pieces inside that you buy.
Part two, lego master builders shows the creation of Mount Rushmore,Grand Central Station, and the statue of liberty.There is also a section with pictures of 'pocket models' small sets and it even shows inspiration for a model of Elvis!
Part three legoland-the parks shows the areas in legoland Billund,Windsor, and California. There is also a long list of miniland models.
Part four Imagination unlimited  has some pretty cool models including a chess set.There is also a section which shows you how a lego helmet is made(this is a life-size helmet,like the one that you put on your head); and lego brick art.
Overall, you should definately get this book if you ever see it.

author: sudorum
title: If only the book was made out of legos....
review: this book contains tons of lego sculptures created by lego land builders. from Mount Rushmore, to Spock from Star Trek, the models are so life like that at first glance they don't even appear to be made out of legos. Such models are the Sydney Opera House, the statue of liberty, the white house, and Grand Central Station. The book also has a history of when the first elements and pieces came out, plus the process of how a lego brick is created. Also included is the process of how lego land builders get into the business.

author: starwarsgeek101_
title: An amazing book!
review: This explains to you EVERYTHING about LEGO from 1942 with Ole Kirk to 1999 when it was released. It has a timeline about lego and shows how modelmakers make amazing structures. It shows the steps to becoming a modelmaker and everything. "GET THIS BOOK. You'll be happy that you did!"

author: C_Fish
title: Outdated, but still good
review:
First off, I do NOT own this book. I checked it out from my library. It is a nice book, though I feel it could use more content about themes.

Pros: Nice Pics.
        A whole page about Rock Raiders, including concept art

Cons: Too much stuff about the parks, too little about themes

Over all, there is'nt much to say. It's a good book.

author: myater
review:
$14.95 according to the price on my book which I got when it came out as a gift and it has been in the family room ever since.

 

The only thing I would liked to have seen in this book was a history of each theme.  If it had a two page section for each theme then I would have given this full bricks.
